sentences: Talvel on suuremad külmad kui sügisel.
Meil on suuremad plaanid kui eelmisel aastal.
context: The word 'suuremad' is the comparative form of the adjective 'suur' meaning big/large in Estonian. It is used to compare two or more things and indicates that something is bigger, larger, or greater than something else. The '-d' ending at the end of the word indicates it's in the plural comparative form.
